title: 106_s2821
content: The Act may be cited as the "FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000". It addresses the creditability of service. The FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000 amends Section 8411(b) of title 5, United States Code to include service as a temporary or intermittent employee for the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation from December 31, 1988, to June 30, 2000, as creditable service. The FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000 allows service as a temporary or intermittent employee for the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation from December 31, 1988, to June 30, 2000, to be creditable for retirement benefits under this chapter. The FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000 requires employees or Members to deposit 1.3 percent of basic pay for service performed under a retirement system established by a law of the United States. The FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000 mandates a 1.3 percent deposit of basic pay for service under a US retirement system. Deposits made more than 5 years later must include interest, and if not made in full, interest will be compounded annually. The FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000 requires a 1.3 percent deposit of basic pay for service under a US retirement system. Deposits made after 5 years must include interest, compounded annually. If the deposit is not made in full, the annuity based on the service will be reduced. SEC. 3. PROVISIONS RELATING TO PERSONS WHO HAVE SEPARATED. The Office of Personnel Management will establish regulations for obtaining credit for service performed by individuals who have separated from Government service. Credit will only be given upon submission of a written application by December 31, 2001. Annuities will be recomputed when an application is submitted. The Office of Personnel Management will establish regulations for obtaining credit for service performed by individuals who have separated from Government service by December 31, 2001. Annuities will be recomputed to include service described in section 8411(b)(6) of title 5, United States Code, effective more than 30 days after the application is submitted. The Office of Personnel Management will establish regulations for obtaining credit for service performed by individuals who have separated from Government service by December 31, 2001. Annuities will be recomputed to include service described in section 8411(b)(6) of title 5, United States Code, effective more than 30 days after the application is submitted. If the full deposit required under section 8411(j) of title 5 is not timely made, a reduction will be made in the recomputed annuity in accordance with regulations. An appropriate reduction will be made in the recomputed annuity if the full deposit required under section 8411(j) of title 5 is not timely made. Interest is not included in any deposit under this subsection. SEC. 4. NOTIFICATION AND OTHER DUTIES OF THE OFFICE OF PERSONNEL MANAGEMENT. The Office of Personnel Management will inform individuals of their rights under the Act and assist in obtaining necessary information from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation will provide information to the Office of Personnel Management regarding an individual's service for entitlement verification or annuity recomputation under the Act.
